paper.title: Infinite Structures in Information Theory

author.org: Jet Propulsion Laboratory of California Institute of Technology

paper.abstract: The idea of infinite structures, even of continua, in information theory is not a new one [K056]. This note is devoted to infinite one-time pads [BL81] and an infinite projective geometric [BL79] threshold scheme. Perhaps an infinite structure can be better understood than its finite analog if it is amenable to investigation by methods from calculus or harmonic analysis. It is conceivable that an existing error control code, pool/split/restitute process [AS82], or cryptosystem can be better understood by examining an infinite version.
